intro: Schefflera brassaiella, commonly known as the African evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the Araliaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its dense, glossy dark green foliage. The plant typically features a single trunk with a crown of large, palmate leaves that are deeply lobed. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers followed by red berries. Schefflera brassaiella is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
